posts.name: Elaine
posts.cooked:
Today, we’re releasing version 7.57 to beta. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group.

Release notes:

  • If you’ve been patiently awaiting a better way to select pictures and videos in Signal, now your expectations aren’t just realistic — they’re photorealistic. This update includes support for the native iOS photo picker, so you can easily search for images and see a consistent view of available albums.
  • We also added a shortcut to scroll to the associated message when looking at an image or video in the All Media view for a chat.

Let us know about any issues you experience! Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.56 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.57.0.749-beta

46 new commits since 7.56.0.738-beta (+ 1 commit omitted):

Show commits

  • Bump version to 7.57 [1]

  • Move TypedItemProvider and pertaining logic to SignalUI [2]

  • Use native iOS photo picker [3]

  • Use native photo picker for username QR codes [4]

  • Remove custom photo picker [5]

  • Fix crash when importing non-empty “My Story”s [6]

  • Update story integration tests to match reality [7]

  • Remove optional that can’t ever be nil [8]

  • Update hero view to support a bottom animation [9]

  • Make photo picker use ordered selection [10]

  • Update media picker button style on camera view [11]

  • Asyncify contact sync processing [12]

  • Don’t assume users are registered from sends [13]

  • Use awaitableWrite when cancelling subscription [14]

  • Make OWSProgress observer async [15]

  • Ensure we always resume AttachmentDownloadManager continuation [16]

  • Pull out backup attachment download eligibility checks into own file [17]

  • Add BackupAttachmentDownloadProgress to drive download progress UI [18]

  • Delete the old subscription when starting anew [19]

  • Update segmented control when group requests/invites count changes [20]

  • Use DeviceId when parsing getDevices response [21]

  • Asyncify Apple Pay “Donate for a Friend” flow [22]

  • Early exit if no backup attachments to download [23]

  • Asyncify ModalActivityIndicatorVC’s cancellations [24]

  • Re-open the attachments keyboard when cancelling an image send [25]

  • Make BackupSettingsViewController a subclass of HostingController [26]

  • Fix deadlock when refreshing groups [27]

  • Don’t send empty sync messages [28]

  • Updated Transfer/Restore UI for old device [29]

  • Use updatedThread for notifications [30]

  • Update QuickRestore request names to be more accurate [31]

  • Populate the restoreMethodToken for registration provisioning requests. [32]

  • Allow 'transferred' as a valid state for the socket manager to encounter [33]

  • Localize the Restore method VC [34]

  • Defensive checks for backup attachment unit counts [35]

  • Rip out ACKing optimization that may cause stalls [36]

  • Add better “recently processed” optimization [37]

  • Use ServiceIds for outgoing message parameters [38]

  • Add DeviceBatteryLevelManager [39]

  • Sort sender key ServiceIds [40]

  • Fix SDS codegen for the one transaction type… [41]

  • Add "go to message" context menu option to media page view [42]

  • Support focusMessageId for presentConversation when thread already selected [43]

  • Allow go-to-message from conversation view [44]

  • Update release notes [45]

  • Update translations [46]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-iOS 7.56.0.738-beta…7.57.0.749-beta

posts.name: link ✦
posts.cooked:
nifty update!

when selecting a raw file, it wants to send it as a dng file rather than a photo

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
awaitlink:

when selecting a raw file, it wants to send it as a dng file rather than a photo

shhhhhh, that’s a good thing

When trying to @ someone after a (, the @ menu doesn’t show and the @-ing failes.

E.g. you want to say (@user1), but this fails and you need to type ( @user1).

Edit: this is also still there:

Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.56 release iOS Beta Feedback
A for everyone deleted message has the typical „tombstone“ look in the info screen [IMG_6831] While it hasn’t in the regular chat view [IMG_6832] Also: Signal crashes when trying to edit a message with a @user1 when user1 left the group after the message had been sent but before the editing.

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.56 release

posts.name: Paul Schon
posts.cooked: I‘m happy with the new photo picker, I only miss to swipe for selecting multiple photos.

posts.name: Delamcode
posts.cooked:
The leprechaun bug is back for me, usually seems to happen when I share an image that was taken by my phone and was uploaded to Immich to my clipboard and try to paste. It at least doesn’t send it like before, but sometimes it glitches out, refuses to send (requiring a recopy), or opens the image sender tool with a green square image…
Not sure if it’s this version specifically but I only noticed it now.

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked: Hi, thanks for reporting. As far as we can tell this is an iOS clipboard issue, in that it sometimes gives us back bad images (e.g., a single-pixel green square). We recently put in place changes to not auto-send these, but it seems like iOS is still giving them to us.

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked: Thanks for reporting – I’ll track this internally.

posts.name: Delamcode
posts.cooked: That’s so weird, I’ve literally never seen it anywhere else but on Signal, and I use clipboard images all the time (like in other messaging apps like Viber). iOS tends to be weird though so I don’t doubt it.

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked: Thanks again for reporting. I’ve addressed the @mention-after-parens issue, and it’ll be rolling out in the next release.

If you have feedback specifically related to the new beta version, please post it in the following topic: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.58 release.
